description: Here, the reinforcement learning specific data of assume will be plotted. Especially the process during the learning

options.content:
#### Introduction

Here we visualize the results of the reinforcement learning process for the specified units that use a learning strategy and the respective learning episodes.
For the overall learning porcess see the tensorboard implementation. This dashboard rather allows you a deep dive into the specific behavioral differences between episodes and units.

#### How to use the dashboard

This interactive tool is designed to help you gain insights into the learning journey of our reinforcement learning (RL) agent. 
Please note all graphs and tables present results of one episode, for an overview see tensorboard. 
To understand the dashboard take note of the following three points:

##### 1. Division of the Dashboard:
The dashboard is divided into two parts. 
The upper part simply give you an idea of all learning related logged parameteres so that you can get an overview of what might be analyzed. 
The lower part focuses the results on specific units, which you can select according to the second point.


##### 2. Selection of Simulation Subsets:
The dashboard is made up of specific plots for certain episodes, timeframes and learning units.
On the top of the dashboard, you'll find a list of available choices for the episode of the simualtion and a list of RL units. 
Choose the ones you're interested in by selecting their names in the list. The selected metrics will be displayed on the choice-specific visualization area.


##### 3. Interaction with Plots:
The plots are interactive. You can zoom in and out, click on data points to view specific details etc.
In the upper left corner of each plot you find additional information about the depicted data.

panels.description: The reward is a measure for the learning agent to determine how desirable (reward > 0) or undesirable (reward < 0) the chosen actions are. This plot shows the rewards averaged over all learning units for each episode.

targets.rawSql:
WITH unit_episode_rewards AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        learning_mode,
        SUM(reward) AS total_reward
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS NOT NULL  -- Ensure learning mode is considered
    GROUP BY episode, unit, learning_mode
),
episode_unit_counts AS (
    SELECT 
        episode, 
        learning_mode,
        COUNT(DISTINCT unit) AS unit_count
    FROM unit_episode_rewards
    GROUP BY episode, learning_mode
)
SELECT 
    u.episode,
    u.learning_mode,
    SUM(u.total_reward) / e.unit_count AS avg_profit
FROM unit_episode_rewards u
JOIN episode_unit_counts e 
    ON u.episode = e.episode 
    AND u.learning_mode = e.learning_mode
GROUP BY u.episode, u.learning_mode, e.unit_count
ORDER BY u.episode, u.learning_mode;

panels.title: Average REWARD of all learning units

panels.description: The evaluation reward is the reward for evaluation episodes which are calculated with unseen data.

targets.rawSql:
WITH unit_episode_rewards AS (
    SELECT
        episode,
        unit,
        SUM(reward) AS total_reward
    FROM rl_params
    WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+'
      AND learning_mode IS TRUE
    GROUP BY episode, unit
),
episode_unit_counts AS (
    SELECT 
        episode, 
        COUNT(DISTINCT unit) AS unit_count
    FROM unit_episode_rewards
    GROUP BY episode
)
SELECT 
    u.episode,
    SUM(u.total_reward) / e.unit_count AS avg_reward
FROM unit_episode_rewards u
JOIN episode_unit_counts e ON u.episode = e.episode
GROUP BY u.episode, e.unit_count
ORDER BY u.episode;

panels.title: Average EVALUATION REWARD of all learning units

targets.rawSql:
-- this query creates a cumulative sum of the reward until now
SELECT 
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime,$__interval),
  'episode ' || episode AS "episode",
  sum(sum(reward)) OVER (PARTITION BY episode ORDER BY datetime) AS "reward"
FROM
  rl_params
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) 
  and (simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' OR simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+')
GROUP BY 1, datetime, episode
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Cumulative average REWARD over all units per episode

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime,$__interval),
  'episode ' || episode AS "episode",
  sum(sum(profit)) OVER (PARTITION BY episode ORDER BY datetime) AS "profit"
FROM
  rl_params
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime)
  and (simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' OR simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+')
GROUP BY 1, datetime, episode
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: Cumulative average PROFIT over all units per episode

panels.description: This gives you the average reward and regret scaled over the entire episode that you selected for one unit.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  episode,
  avg(reward) as reward
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' AND
      unit = '$rl_unit' AND learning_mode is true
group by episode
order by episode

panels.title: Avg. REWARD of unit $rl_unit

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  datetime,
  simulation,
  unit,
  (episode::float),
  reward,
  regret
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+' AND
      unit = '$rl_unit' AND learning_mode is true And episode = ${episode}

SELECT
  datetime,
  simulation,
  unit,
  (episode::float),
  reward
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_[1-9]+' AND
      unit = '$rl_unit' and perform_evaluation is True

panels.description: Give you the absolute revenue made in the episode in Euro.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  datetime,
  simulation,
  unit,
  (episode::float),
  profit
FROM rl_params
WHERE simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'  AND
      unit = '$rl_unit' AND learning_mode is true AND
      episode = ${episode}

panels.title: Total PROFIT of unit $rl_unit

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime, $__interval),
  CASE
    WHEN actions_0 >= actions_1 THEN actions_1
    WHEN actions_0 < actions_1 THEN actions_0 
  END AS "noisy_action_Pinflex",
  CASE
    WHEN actions_0 >= actions_1 THEN GREATEST(-1, LEAST(1, actions_1 - exploration_noise_1))
    WHEN actions_0 < actions_1 THEN GREATEST(-1, LEAST(1, actions_0 - exploration_noise_0))
  END AS "action_Pinflex",
  simulation AS "simulation"
FROM rl_params
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) AND
  (
    -- Handle "eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     episode = CAST(REGEXP_REPLACE('${episode}'::text, '^eval_', '') AS DOUBLE PRECISION) )
    OR
    -- Handle non-"eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text NOT LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     episode = CAST('${episode}' AS DOUBLE PRECISION))
  ) AND
  unit = '$rl_unit'
ORDER BY 1;

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(datetime,$__interval),
  case
    when actions_0 <= actions_1 then actions_1
    when actions_0 > actions_1 then actions_0 
  end as "noisy_action_Pflex",
  case
    when actions_0 <= actions_1 then GREATEST(-1, LEAST(1, actions_1 - exploration_noise_1)) 
    when actions_0 > actions_1 then GREATEST(-1, LEAST(1, actions_0 - exploration_noise_0))
  end as "action_Pflex",
  simulation AS "simulation"
FROM rl_params
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(datetime) AND
  (
    -- Handle "eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     episode = CAST(REGEXP_REPLACE('${episode}'::text, '^eval_', '') AS DOUBLE PRECISION) )
    OR
    -- Handle non-"eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text NOT LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     episode = CAST('${episode}' AS DOUBLE PRECISION))
  ) AND
  unit = '$rl_unit'
ORDER BY 1

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  avg(accepted_volume/volume) AS "accepted_volume"
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time)
  and simulation = '$simulation'
GROUP BY 1, start_time
ORDER BY 1

panels.title: [iP] Average Accepted Volume Ratio for all Units

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time, $__interval),
  price AS "bid_price",
  volume AS "bid_volume",
  simulation AS "simulation",
  unit_id
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  (
    -- Handle "eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     simulation ~ '^${simulation}_eval_')
    OR
    -- Handle non-"eval_" cases
    ('${episode}'::text NOT LIKE 'eval_%' AND 
     simulation ~ '^${simulation}_')
  )
  AND unit_id = '$rl_unit'
ORDER BY 1;

SELECT
  $__timeGroupAlias(start_time,$__interval),
  volume AS "Bid volume:",
  bid_id as "bid_id"
FROM market_orders
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(start_time) AND
  simulation = '$simulation'
  AND unit_id = '$rl_unit'
GROUP BY 1, unit_id, volume, bid_id
ORDER BY 1

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT
SUBSTRING(m.simulation, 0, LENGTH(m.simulation) +1  - strpos(REVERSE(m.simulation),'_')) AS market_simulation
FROM rl_params m
where perform_evaluation is False and learning_mode is True
list.description: Can choose which simulation we want to show
list.name: simulation
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT
SUBSTRING(m.simulation, 0, LENGTH(m.simulation) +1  - strpos(REVERSE(m.simulation),'_')) AS market_simulation
FROM rl_params m
where perform_evaluation is False and learning_mode is True

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT unit
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'
list.description: All units that have an reinforcment learning strategy and hence have the Rl specific parameteres logged
list.label: rl_unit
list.name: rl_unit
list.query:
SELECT DISTINCT unit
FROM rl_params
where simulation ~ '^${simulation}_[1-9]+'

list.definition:
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN simulation LIKE '%eval_%'
        THEN REGEXP_SUBSTR(simulation, 'eval_[0-9]+$')  -- Extract 'eval_' + number
        ELSE REGEXP_SUBSTR(simulation, '[0-9]+$')       -- Extract only the number
    END AS extracted_value
FROM rl_params;
list.label: Episode
list.name: episode
list.query:
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN simulation LIKE '%eval_%'
        THEN REGEXP_SUBSTR(simulation, 'eval_[0-9]+$')  -- Extract 'eval_' + number
        ELSE REGEXP_SUBSTR(simulation, '[0-9]+$')       -- Extract only the number
    END AS extracted_value
FROM rl_params;

title: ASSUME: Training progress
